summary:
## Logistic Regression Simplified

Logistic regression is a statistical tool that predicts the chance of something happening (like passing a test) based on factors like how many hours you study. It uses a "logistic" curve to show how likely something is to occur.

Imagine a graph where the x-axis is study hours and the y-axis is the chance of passing. The logistic curve starts at 0% chance, goes up to 100%, and looks like an "S".  The model uses numbers (coefficients) to weigh how much each factor (like study hours) influences the final probability.
title: Logistic regression
